bug.short_desc: provide API for encoding/decoding task id

long_desc.thetext:
RepositoryTaskHandleUtil forbids usage of '-' in task ids, since it's used as a delimiter for a task handle identifier. This is problematic for repositories that have a hyphen in their task ids (such as would be the case with a formatted UUID).
The tasks framework should provide API for encoding/decoding task ids. Preferably the encoded form would only encode those characters that were absolutely necessary (as opposed to CoreUtil which encodes any non-alphanumeric characters) so that the encoded form is as close to the original form as possible for ease of debugging.

The encode/decode methods in CoreUtil exist for a reason. We encountered cases where non alphanumeric characters could not be used in filenames on various operating systems and hence most are encoded. The representation is internal. I'm not convinced it's worth replacing a proven and tested mechanism at this point.

Thanks Steffen.
Marking as "won't fix" since as you point out task handle identifiers must be valid filename characters. CoreUtil already serves the purpose.
Perhaps if/when the Mylyn data store is not filesystem dependent we can revisit this issue, or get rid of the character restriction entirely.
